8. If possible and safe, follow the suspect vehicle at a distance to maintain sight until police arrive—but never endanger yourself or others.

pre.rewrite_response:
• Assess severity. If the child can still cough or speak, encourage forceful coughing.  
• If the child cannot breathe, cry or speak:  
  1. Call emergency services (or have someone else call).  
  2. For a child over 1 year:  
     - Stand or kneel behind them.  
     - Deliver up to five firm abdominal thrusts (Heimlich maneuver).  
     - If obstruction persists, alternate five back blows (between shoulder blades) with five abdominal thrusts.  
  3. For an infant under 1 year:  
     - Support the head and jaw.  
     - Deliver five back blows with the heel of your hand.  
     - Turn infant face‐up and give five gentle chest thrusts (two fingers at the center of the chest).  
• If the child becomes unresponsive:  
  - Lay them on a firm surface.  
  - Begin CPR (30 compressions, open airway, two rescue breaths), checking the mouth for visible obstructions before each breath.
